children.name: access
children.definition: how easy or difficult it is for people to enter a public building, to reach a place, or talk to sb : khả nang tiếp cận, đến được (qua một lối đi hay phương tiện)
examples: access for
We’re trying to improve access for disabled visitors.
access to
a villa witheasy accessto the sea
The only accesstothe village is by boat.

children.name: entrance
children.definition: a door, gate etc that you go through to enter a placeOPP exit: lối vào, cửa vào
examples: entrance to/of
themain entranceto the school
It took us ages to find the entrance to the park.

children.name: the main entrance
examples: She found a parking space close to the hospital's main entrance.

children.name: the front/back/rear/side entrance
examples: There is a long drive with steps leading to the front entrance.

children.name: a narrow entrance
examples: I could see part of the yard through the narrow entrance.

children.name: a wide entrance
examples: There was a wide entrance at the front of the building.

children.name: the hotel/hospital/museum etc entrance
examples: Our taxi pulled up outside the hotel entrance.

children.name: the harbour entrance
examples: British English,the harbor entranceAmerican English We watched as the ferry approached the harbour entrance.

children.name: the tunnel entrance
examples: At high tide, the tunnel entrance is totally submerged.

children.name: come/go/pass etc through an entrance
examples: People passed in single file through the narrow entrance.

children.name: use an entrance
examples: It's quicker to use the side entrance.

children.name: block an entrance
examples: A large stone blocked the entrance to the tomb.

children.name: an entrance hall
children.definition: a room at the entrance to a building
examples: He walked through the front door into the entrance hall.

children.name: an entrance lobby/foyer
children.definition: an area at the entrance to a large building
examples: There was no sign of her in the entrance foyer.

children.name: an entrance gate/door
examples: Soldiers were guarding the entrance gate.

children.name: entry
children.definition: / entrywayUS a door, gate, room, or passage that you go through to enter a place:lối vào , cổng vào
examples: Over the entryway was an inscription in Latin.

children.name: entry/entryway to/of
examples: We stopped at the entry to the church to admire the architecture.

children.name: way in
children.definition: theentranceto alargepublic building:lối vào
examples: We walked all the way around the museum looking for the way in.
There’s a red flashing sign above the door saying ‘Way In’ - you can’t miss it.

children.name: access
children.definition: the way things are arranged so that the public can enter somewhere:lối vào
examples: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
The entrance has been widened to give improved access for disabled people
access to
Access to the restrooms is through the foyer.
City officials are considering building a path to give the public access to the ruins.
The main accesstothe building is at the side.

children.name: when sth enters a space, especially through a surface
seep in
children.definition: if liquid seeps in, it gradually enters a substance or a place:rỉ qua, thấm qua
examples: Despite all our efforts to stop it, the floodwater was still seeping in.

children.name: seep into sth
examples: Chemicals from the plant have seeped into the city’s water supply.

children.name: enter
children.definition: đi vào
examples: The bullet entered his rib cage from the left side.

children.name: enter through/by etc
examples: Bacteria can enter through a cut or graze on the skin.

children.name: penetrate
children.definition: if sth penetrates an object or substance, it fully enters it, or goes through it:xuyên qua
examples: The sun’s rays can penetrate the sea to a depth of twenty metres.
He threw a grenade that penetrated the wall of the building and exploded inside.

children.name: permeate
children.definition: if liquid, gas etc permeates sth, it enters it and spreads through every part of it : ngấm, thấm
examples: The smell of diesel oil permeated the air.
Toxic chemicals may permeate the soil, threatening the environment.

children.name: permeate through/into
examples: Rain permeates through the ground to add to ground water levels.

children.name: exit
children.definition: a door or space through which you can leave a public room, building etc : lối ra, lối thoát
examples: We made for the nearest exit.

children.name: a fire/emergency exit
children.definition: a special door, used if there is an emergency or a fire
examples: Fire crews discovered that the club’s fire exit door had been locked.

children.name: the front/rear/side exit
examples: When the lights dimmed, she slipped out by the rear exit.

children.name: the nearest exit
examples: Please leave the building in an orderly fashion, using the nearest exit.

children.name: head for/make for the exit
children.definition: go to the exit
examples: Disappointed fans began heading for the exits.

children.name: use an exit
examples: In the event of a fire, please use the emergency exit nearest to you.

children.name: an exit door
examples: Exit doors shouldn’t be blocked at any time.

children.name: an exit route
children.definition: a way out of a building, plane etc, used in an emergency or a fire
examples: Staff must become familiar with the building’s exit routes.

children.name: an exit sign
children.definition: one showing where an exit is
examples: There was a red glowing exit sign over the door.

children.name: an exit door
examples: Two men were blocking her exit.

children.name: intrusion
children.definition: when sb goes into a place or situation where they are not wanted or expected to be : can thiệp
examples: They complained about excessive government intrusion (= unwanted involvement)intotheir legitimate activities.
His phone call was awelcomeintrusion into an otherwise tedious morning.

children.name: entry
children.definition: the act of going into somethingOPP exit

children.name: gain entry
examples: Burglars use various methods to gain entry to houses.

children.name: force an entry
children.definition: get into a building by breaking a door, window etc
examples: The church was locked, but he managed to force an entry.

children.name: make your entry
children.definition: enter in a way that makes other people notice you
examples: She waited until everyone was sitting down before she made her entry.

children.name: illegal entry
children.definition: when someone gets into a building illegally
examples: The two men were later arrested and charged with illegal entry.

children.name: unauthorized entry
children.definition: when someone gets into a place where they are not allowed
examples: There was a big sign on the door saying NO UNAUTHORIZED ENTRY.

children.name: forced entry
children.definition: when someone gets into a building illegally by breaking a door, window etc
examples: There were no signs of a forced entry, but several paintings were missing.

children.name: an entry point
children.definition: a place where people can enter a country
examples: The 2,000 mile border is the main entry point into the country for illegal aliens.

children.name: entry into
examples: It was dark and their entry into the camp had gone unnoticed.
Harrymadehisentryinto the village.

children.name: admission
children.definition: permission given to sb to enter a building or place : quyền vào cửa, quyền ra vào
examples: No admission after 10 pm.
There's a notice outside the building which says 'No admission before 12 noon'.
The young men tried to enter a nightclub but wererefused admission.
Womengained admissionto the club only recently.

children.name: admission to
examples: Admissiontothe exhibition will be by invitation only.

children.name: entrance
children.definition: the right to enter a place : quyền ra vào
examples: Reporters even managed togain entranceto her hotel.
How much is theentrance fee(= money you pay to get in somewhere )?
The management reserve the right torefuseentrance.

children.name: entrance to
examples: Entrance to the museum is free.

children.name: access
children.definition: the right to enter a place, use sth, see sb etc : quyền vào, truy cập, sử dụng, etc

children.name: access to
examples: Access to the papers is restricted to senior management.
Cats should alwayshave accessto fresh, clean water.
gain/get access (to sh)to succeed in entering a place or in seeing sb or sth :
The police managed to gain access through an upstairs window.

children.name: entry
children.definition: the right to enter a place, building etc : quyền ra vào

children.name: free
examples: Guests have free entry to the hotel spa and gym.|Entry is free for children.

children.name: an entry visa
children.definition: a visa which allows you to enter a country
examples: Visitors to the United States must first obtain an entry visa.

children.name: an entry ticket
children.definition: a ticket that allows you to enter a place
examples: The holiday includes a 2-day entry ticket to the Euro Disneyland Theme Park.

children.name: apply for entry
examples: The number of people applying for entry into the country is increasing every year.

children.name: allow
children.definition: somebody
examples: entry(alsogrant (somebody) entryformal) (= let someone enter a place )Citizens of most EU countries are allowed automatic entry into Britain.

children.name: refuse/deny
children.definition: somebody
examples: entry(= stop someone entering )He was refused entry to the club because he was wearing trainers.

children.name: no entry
children.definition: written on signs to show that you are not allowed to go somewhere
examples: The door had ‘No Entry’ written in large letters.

children.name: entry to/into
examples: Entry to the gardens is included in the price of admission.
